title: Bone Marrow
author: ayobami
description: Let's go into the bone and review facts about the bone marrow

questions.question: Bone marrow is found the cortical part of bone
The bone marrow is about 4% of the body weight
Yellow marrow is characterized by containing more hematopoietic cells than adipocytes
Yellow marrow is characterized by containing less hematopoietic cells than adipocytes
Red marrow is characterized by containing more hematopoietic cells than adipocytes
A newborns' bone marrow is 100% red marrow
In adulthood, the bone marrow is 75% red, and 25% yellow marrow
Yellow marrow, once formed, is permanent.
During fetal life, the liver is the major organ for hematopoiesis
In the bone marrow, stromal cells act as main cells in hematopoieisis
In bone marrow, hemapoiesis takes place in the avascular portion
Parenchymal cells in the bone marrow create a microenviroment for hematopoiesis to take place
The bone marrow barrier helps to prevent immature red cells from flooding the blood
Bone marrow is an organ of the reticuloendothelial system

questions.text: cranium(I), clavicle(II), scapula(III), ribs(IV), vertebrae(V), ulna(VI), phalanges(VII), iliac bone(VIII), tibia(IX), femur(X)
questions.question: I, II and V are bones where hematopoiesis typically takes place

questions.text: cranium(I), clavicle(II), scapula(III), ribs(IV), vertebrae(V), ulna(VI), phalanges(VII), iliac bone(VIII), tibia(IX), femur(X)
questions.question: I, III, V, and VIII are the only bones here that typically contain red marrow

questions.text: cranium(I), clavicle(II), scapula(III), ribs(IV), vertebrae(V), ulna(VI), phalanges(VII), iliac bone(VIII), tibia(IX), femur(X)
questions.question: I, III, IV, V, VIII, IX and X are the only bones here that typically contain red marrow
